meta.description:
Imagine you're planning your meals for the day and you want to ensure you're meeting all your nutritional needs without overspending. You have five food options: Chicken, Pasta, Rice, Beans, and Cheese. Each of these foods provides different amounts of protein, carbohydrates, and calories, along with their respective costs.

Here's a breakdown of what each food offers and how much it costs:

- Chicken: Provides 5 grams of protein, 13 grams of carbohydrates, and 121 calories for $7.
- Pasta: Offers 3 grams of protein, 23 grams of carbohydrates, and 274 calories for $10.
- Rice: Contains 11 grams of protein, 27 grams of carbohydrates, and 251 calories for $7.
- Beans: Supplies 10 grams of protein, 27 grams of carbohydrates, and 259 calories for $9.
- Cheese: Gives you 4 grams of protein, 18 grams of carbohydrates, and 199 calories for $7.

Your goal is to get at least 60 grams of protein, 146 grams of carbohydrates, and 1727 calories from any combination of these foods. What is the cheapest cost to meet your nutritional needs?

params.name: protein
params.description: Protein content of each food option

params.name: carbohydrates
params.description: Carbohydrate content of each food option

params.name: calories
params.description: Calorie content of each food option

vars.name: x
vars.description: Number of servings of each food

objective.name: minimize_cost
objective.expr: quicksum(cost[f] * x[f] for f in Foods)
objective.description: Minimize the total cost of food

constraints.name: protein_requirement
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(protein[f] * x[f] for f in Foods)
constraints.description: Ensure at least 60 grams of protein

constraints.name: carbohydrates_requirement
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(carbohydrates[f] * x[f] for f in Foods)
constraints.description: Ensure at least 146 grams of carbohydrates

constraints.name: calories_requirement
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(calories[f] * x[f] for f in Foods)
